item.title: Bifurcation in optimal retirement
item.description: arXiv:2506.02155v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study optimal consumption and retirement using a Cobb-Douglas utility and a simple model in which an interesting bifurcation arises. With high wealth, individuals plan to retire. With low wealth they plan to never retire. At a critical level of initial wealth they may choose to defer this decision, leading to a continuum of wealth trajectories with identical utilities.
